definitions.definition: Amiable , flexible , easy to get along with .
examples: His facile disposition made him many friends.
Her writing was facile and articulate.

definitions.definition: Lazy , simplistic , superficial (especially of explanations, discussions etc.).
examples: He arrived with a facile understanding of her works.

definitions.definition: Of a reaction or other process , taking place readily .
examples: Decarboxylation of beta-keto acids is facile .

main_definition: ( now usually derogatory ) Easy ; contemptibly easy. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) Amiable , flexible , easy to get along with . [from 16th c.]
Effortless , fluent (of work, abilities etc.). [from 17th c.]
Lazy , simplistic , superficial (especially of explanations, discussions etc.). [from 19th c.]
( chemistry ) Of a reaction or other process , taking place readily .
